attributes.action: Condemn the military action against ethnic Kurds by Iran and Iraq.
attributes.background: After the decision by the people of Kurdistan for independence in a referendum, retaliatory force by the Iranian backed militia and the Iraqi army against Kurdish populations in Kirkuk have resulted in dispossession and ethnically motivated crime.

attributes.action: An NHS follow up for those suffering from mental health
attributes.background: I want anyone with depression in their medical history, to have a home visit from a professional, regularly. Access to support groups in every town. To deliver anti-depressants to their home. To signpost them to charitable organizations available.
attributes.additional_details:
For those affected to have access to a free gym membership, healthy food delivered to their door and an annual trip to a concert/show/item of interest. A postal scheme whereby every month leaflets about mental health and how to get help are posted through every door in the United Kingdom and for these to be displayed in every room in every NHS service available to both the public and professionals.
It is said that 1 in 4 people currently suffer from depression in the United Kingdom alone, 6188 have taken their own lives in 2017. It is time to make a change.

attributes.action: End any form of Monarchy in the UK and end all payments to the Royal Family.
attributes.background: Considering the financial state of the UK and with costs being cut left, right and centre is it perhaps time we cut one of the largest expenses? The Queen receives a HUGE payment from the tax payers of the United Kingdom on top of profits made from her own private lands. Both in the millions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Royal Family spend millions on travel, renovations and many luxuries. These costs don't include the hiring of security, among other things such as Royal Weddings. 
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2017/jun/27/queens-income-rises-to-82m-to-cover-cost-of-buckingham-palace-works
https://www.coventrytelegraph.net/news/coventry-news/how-much-royal-family-cost-14111218

attributes.action: Make ADHD part of the blue badge scheme
attributes.background: Autism and physical disabilities are included in the blue badge scheme but people don’t understand how hard it is to catch public transport and make your journey with an ADHD child!! When they have a set routine and you miss your bus ADHD is just a challenge as any other disability.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if ADHD children got accepted for a blue badge it would help a lot of families . Like less melt downs, less late trips or making shopping easier. Nothing is worse than having errands to do and your child is kicking off because you are 10 minutes late home and they have a certain routine.

attributes.action: Standardizing the work week to 4 days with a 3 day weekend.
attributes.background:
Increased productivity for business (studies show that employees working a four-day work week are more productive and happier overall); 
Cutting child care issues and costs, health problems from work related stress and an overall healthier work life balance.

attributes.action: Lower car tax and fuel benefit for diesel company cars after this years tax hike
attributes.background: The company car has become a cash cow for the government over the last few years. Many field representatives earn modest salaries, and have job cars where they have no choice of  model, engine type, etc. I would like to see the system made more fair after this years massive increase in tax.

attributes.action: Make supermarkets supply a point in store to discard excessive packaging
attributes.background: Facility to remove excessive amount of packaging within the store. Force a change to packaging habits by supermarkets and prevent contamination of products to be recycled

attributes.action: Remove Chris Brown’s ban from the U.K. and allow him access to the country.
attributes.background: Global sensation and pop-culture figure, Chris Brown was publicly banned from entering the United Kingdom in 2009 following his domestic abuse and violent history towards then girlfriend, Rihanna. I believe that the ban should be lifted almost 10 years on so Brown can come and perform in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details: My knowledge from the Daily Mail and love for Chris Brown are my references.

attributes.action: Commemorate the life of Stephen Hawking with a day of national mourning.
attributes.background:
One of the greatest minds of his generation.
A national treasure.
Influential for years to come.

attributes.action: Removal of the traffic calming on the Northway Lane M5 flyover
attributes.background: Nearly every day there’s a near miss on the M5 Northway Lane bridge because of the traffic calming measures as people either ignore the give way and going too fast! People also can’t see over the brow! The local road safety team don’t want to know about the state of the counties roads or anything

attributes.action: Put retirement age back to 60 for females and 60 for men.
attributes.background: I am 58 years old. Working with all sorts of conditions: COPD; Glucoma; 2 bad discs; Arthritis. To try and get time off to see a doctor is almost impossible. Getting up is a struggle. But I am not entitled to disability as I can dress wash and feed myself. Everyday is a struggle.

attributes.action: Stop firms from increasing subscription prices during a contract.
attributes.background: When customers sign up to mobile, broadband, landline or a TV contract there is always a clause that the company can increase their prices in line with inflation.  A contract price should remain the same throughout its duration. This unfair practice needs to stop.

attributes.action: Compulsory to not repay any Tax Credits overpayments until it's been disputed
attributes.background: So many people receive letters from tax credits about overpayments that have to be paid back before it can be disputed. We need to make it compulsory that all evidence and appeals are done before any repayments have to be set up.
attributes.additional_details: I personally have been in this situation and from speaking to a number of people that have also experienced this, it would seem that once tax credits have received repayments or some form of monthly repayment method then they are no longer interested at looking at any evidence to dispute an overpayment. Therefore people are left with debts that are incorrect and have to pay them all back because they don't think they have any other option.

attributes.action: Make funeral wishes legally binding documents.
attributes.background: Having worked in the care sector for a number of years I have been amazed to discover that a persons funeral wishes that they specified are not legally binding.
attributes.additional_details: Having worked in the care sector for a number of years I have been amazed to discover that a persons funeral wishes that they specified are not legally binding. It's ultimately it is for your executors or administrators (where there are no executors) to decide upon how your body is disposed of and your funeral conducted. This is not acceptable. Surely a person who leaves an estate has the right to choose how their funeral is conducted and how their body is disposed of.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to prevent farm animals from moving freely for long periods
attributes.background: Many farm animals are prevented from moving by tethering to stanchions in sheds, tie stalls and "zero grazing" systems for dairy cattle - and rarely or never letting them outside. Pigs are given no space to move in tiny "sow stalls" ; chickens by so many being in one shed they can barely move.
attributes.additional_details:
For information on zero grazing systems, tie stalls and tethering by the neck unable to move in dairy farming see this link
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235185/the-life-of-dairy-cows.pdf
On "sow stalls" for pigs leaving them unable to move at all
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235118/The-life-of-Pigs.pdf
Chickens farmed for meat
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235306/The-life-of-Broiler-chickens.pdf
Chickens farmed for eggs
https://www.ciwf.org.uk/media/5235024/The-life-of-laying-hens.pdf

attributes.action: Recognise a need for local and government financial support for carers under 18
attributes.background: There are about 700,000 young carers (under 18) in the UK. They provide everyday care and support to their parents and relatives that adults carers do. However, they are not entitled to a such support as adult carers are. It is time the government considers how best to support these children.

attributes.action: To also be seen as a breach of contact when a father doesn’t show up to contact
attributes.background: I have a child arrangement order in place with my ex partner which states I have to make my child  available for contact if I do not I am breaching the court order and can be fined or even imprisoned yet if he doesnt show the court don’t see that as a breach
attributes.additional_details: I feel it is only fair that if the court orders things in a child arrangement order and it must be abided by law by myself then also my ex partner should be treated the same in the event of repeatedly not bothering to show up especially with no explanation. I feel it is only fair in this day and age that both parties in the situation be treated/punished equally in the event of breaking contact which has been ordered by the court.

attributes.action: Grant my sick mum indefinite leave to remain
attributes.background: On 24/11/2017 my mum was detained at a IR centre and hastily removed from the UK giving us little time to prepare given her age. The NRC just sent her back without proper consultation or duty of care as to how she would be cared for once she is there, since her immediate family is here in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: My father was a political refugee following the 1980 elections in Jamaica, it was hard for mum as a single mother with little education. I migrated to the UK in 1997 to join my wife who was having our first child. My mum traveled back and forth to the UK for visits. When we were about to have our 3rd child in 2002, we decided that it was best for her to stay and that was the start of our struggles with the Home Office to get them to grant her indefinite leave to remain.

attributes.action: Restrict the public sale of fireworks to silent firework types
attributes.background: When it comes to Guy Fawkes night and New Years Eve the disturbance created by the sale of fireworks is extreme. The general public should only be able to purchase "silent fireworks" to limit the inconvenience they cause. Pets and people of nervous disposition experience terror during this time.
attributes.additional_details: My pet dog absolutely hates the time of year when Fireworks are let off, the sale of explosive fireworks should be banned and replaced with "silent fireworks" which are available on the Continent. This would allow people to enjoy the firework displays without disturbance to animals and people with young children. Restrict the sale of industrial strength explosive fireworks to licenced displays only

attributes.action: Persistent drunk drivers with 3 or more should be banned from driving for life.
attributes.background: Norfolk Police have arrested 57 people in 9 days for driving over the limit.
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are repeat drink driving offenders.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-24281043

Too many persistent offenders serve a short ban and are then able to reapply for their licences. For those who are clearly never going to learn we need the ultimate sanction. Fines and imprisonment are not enough. A lifetime driving ban will keep the roads safe for the vast majoriry of sensible drivers.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health Awareness Training Mandatory for All Employers and Managers
attributes.background: Mental health problems have a greater impact on people’s ability to work than any other group of disorders. At the moment, we have no mandatory protocol, training or support for people who suffer with Mental Illness and this usually ends in dismissal by a manager or resignation of an employee.
attributes.additional_details: I, as well as thousands of other people in the UK, find it hard to talk out about Mental Health, especially when our Job is concerned. We can’t come to terms with telling our Manager as we fear for our job. People suffering with Depression, Anxiety or any other Mental Health condition should be supported at work. This Petition is to make Employers and Managers carry out the correct training to educate them on what we go through on a daily basis and ways to avoid our conditions spiralling

attributes.action: To raise the issue of forced marriages with the governments of other countries.
attributes.background: me and some other students are doing a citizenship campaign and one of the things we need to is take action. the rates of forced marriage in other countries are very high and we would like to make a change.

attributes.action: Remove prescription fees for those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: From our experience, many people suffering with mental health issues need a number of prescriptions, which are expensive. In particular those with bipolar have difficulty managing their money - it’s part of the illness. Bipolar is life threatening - their prescription should be free.

attributes.action: Guarantee the right to remain in the UK of all Afghan interpreters
attributes.background: Afghan interpreters who served with the UK Armed Forces on Op HERRICK are currently at risk of deportation from the UK. If sent to Afghanistan they will likely be killed by the Taliban. We ask the Govt to grant Afghan interpreters and their families citizenship and the right to remain in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/news/afghan-interpreters-fear-being-sent-home-to-their-fate-under-visa-rules-0d7qdn8vr
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-manchester-43904806
https://www.thesun.co.uk/news/6198982/afghan-interpreters-uk-eviction-home-office-2400/

attributes.action: Britain should apologize for forced conscription in her West African colonies.
attributes.background: During WWII, Her Majesty’s Government forcefully conscripted young men from the former British West African colonies of the Gold Coast (now Ghana), Nigeria, Sierra Leone and the Gambia to fight against the Axis powers. It is estimated that the West African colonies supplied over 240,000 soldiers.
attributes.additional_details:
They experienced racial, and other forms, of discrimination compared to British soldiers. Tens of thousands of West African troops were killed in action or died of disease. Their families received no support or financial recompense from the colonial administration. Many of those who survived returned home from the frontlines with combat-related Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and received no support or financial recompense from the colonial administration.
Please visit www.westafricaapology.com for further details.

attributes.action: Don't Abolish the House of Lords!
attributes.background: The House of Lords is a great parliamentary asset. Having a body that checks the Commons while being outside of the electoral process prevents rivalry and keeps the system balanced!
attributes.additional_details: If we had an elected Senate in place of the Lords, it would simply rival the Commons. Fundamentally, in elected office, politicians must make promises that pander to voters to keep them elected. The House of Lords doesn't have to fear electoral defeat because they have lifelong tenure and can focus on getting the job done of checking policy! They don't need to be accountable; that's what we have the Commons for whose power is the greatest of the two houses!

attributes.action: OFSTED to closely monitor training qualifications provided by care organisations
attributes.background: All care companies should have, their training programmes Ofsted inspected, and assessors to hold the minimum of a teaching degree.
attributes.additional_details: Currently care companies, self regulate their in house training programmes. This leaves their training programmes wide open not only to educational fraud, but also the substandard delivery and assessment of  in-house training programmes. Each in-house training programme should also lead to a nationally recognised qualification. Which should be standardised internally and externally.

attributes.action: Let the public ask for animal abusers to have unduly lenient sentences reviewed.
attributes.background: Animal abuse is currently not one of the crimes for which members of the public can ask for unduly lenient sentences to be reviewed.  This needs to change urgently.

attributes.action: Ban TV alcohol advertising completely.
attributes.background:
There are far too many alcohol adverts on TV. Pretty much all of them glamourise alcohol use, making it seem like you'll have a more adventurous life by drinking.

Let's save our people, help alcoholics quit and reduce binge drinking, by banning alcohol advertising on TV completely!
attributes.additional_details:
We all know how much damage alcohol causes. Many thousands of people are hospitalised yearly due to the use (or OVER use) of alcohol.

It is a scourge on our young people, in whom we are now seeing record levels of binge drinking amongst teenagers and people in their early 20s. 

The Beer federation at one point put out a literal "Beer goes with everything" advert. Why is this OK?

NO MORE ENCOURAGEMENT OF DRINKING BY GLAMOURISING IT IN OUR TV ADVERTISING!

attributes.action: Put pressure on the US government to be stricter in relation to gun usage
attributes.background: On Wednesday 14th February, a shooting took place at a High School in Florida. There are, at the moment, 17 known fatalities and many other casualties. This is not the first occasion in which guns have affected people's safety.

attributes.action: Take in our fair share of refugees from the Mediterranean crisis
attributes.background: The crisis in the Mediterranean has seen a shocking display of reluctance to take action in order to help those fleeing war and disaster. Countries such as Italy have been left alone to disproportionately host refugees and asylum seekers. It's government's moral duty to host our fair share.
attributes.additional_details: In July 2017, Italy pleaded for the help of other European nations to deal with the record influx of refugees it was experiencing. In 2016, Italy took in a total of 181,436 people (TIME magazine). In 2016 the UK received 38,500 asylum applications, only 45% of these were granted (British Red Cross). The number of applications were considerably less than that of Germany (587,346) and Sweden (83,103).

attributes.action: Increased sentences for assaulting a police officer.
attributes.background: The police do a difficult and quite often thankless job in order to keep our communities safe, all too often this can be a very dangerous job.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the sentence for assaulting a police officer ranges from a from a fine to a maximum of 6 months in prison. 

Recently a police officer in the West Midlands police was assaulted and had a large chunk of hair ripped from her head whilst attending a domestic incident, her attacker received a paltry 12 weeks suspended sentence. 
https://www.itv.com/news/central/2018-01-12/police-woman-has-hair-ripped-out-after-being-assaulted-on-shift/ 

This kind of lenient sentencing will only serve to demoralise the police when they should be given full support from the courts. I therefore propose that a minimum custodial sentence of 18 months be introduced for any assault on a police officer.

attributes.action: Change the criteria for PIP assessments
attributes.background: Many disabled have been taken off their benefits despite no improvement to their condition. The PIP criteria does not adequately assess the effects of disability and is far too severe. It should be changed under the advice of doctors and disabled people.
attributes.additional_details: To qualify for the disability part of working tax credits you must receive PIP, but nowhere in PIP is your ability to work assessed. The PIP assessment is unconcerned with your quality of life and tries to fit disabled people into narrow tick boxes which often aren’t appropriate. Many feel that the PIP assessment is poorly suited to its purpose. The general public, disabled in particular, should be consulted and in partnership with doctors, a new system drawn up.

attributes.action: To be allowed 500 words / 2 sides of notes to every GCSE exam.
attributes.background: As a GCSE student, me and other students feel it would be beneficial to let all students have at least 500 words or 2 sides of notes during a GCSE exam. As the exams should teach students knowledge on how to apply information and use it correctly and efficiently, and not to cram excess information.

attributes.action: Require all products sold in the UK containing plastic to have a warning label.
attributes.background: Plastic pollution is an ever growing global and local problem. It's important that consumers realise what they are buying, products/packaging containing plastic should bare a warning label to enable consumers to make better choices and to encourage producers to look for better alternatives.

attributes.action: Ban serving MPs holding paid directorships and significant 'outside interests'
attributes.background: MPs are our representatives, who, at present are paid an adequate £74,962 in line with inflation; with expenses to carry out their role. Yet, in 2015 some 180 MPs had second jobs, earning a total of £7.4m a year. Of these 112 were Conservative MPs and 43 were Labour.
attributes.additional_details: This is wrong. MPs are elected solely to represent the people and should, therefore, dedicate their full attention to fulfilling this duty, without the need for additional employment.

attributes.action: Make the purchase and use of pepper spray and/or stun devices legal.
attributes.background: It is almost illegal to defend yourself in the UK. I think it is about time; especially considering current situation, that it changes. It should be legal to carry an item for the purpose of defence and the above items should be legalised, even if licensing is required.

attributes.action: A final referendum on EU membership at the same time as a General Election.
attributes.background:
Once this Government has completed their negotiations with the EU27, they should resign and a General Election be called before implementing our departure from the EU.

At the same time a binding referendum on EU membership be held and the subsequent Parliament be obliged to implement the result.
attributes.additional_details: This would ensure a proper debate on the issues, with the electorate clear about the consequences of their votes.  There would be no reason to object to the result with all the facts known and new Parliament elected fully aware of its obligations.

attributes.action: Make online markets such as eBay responsible for issuing a full Vat invoice.
attributes.background: Rarely are proper invoices sent out with purchases made on line, it should be the responsibility of the online market to issue a full invoice with sellers details at time of purchase and it should clearly show before final payment if Vat is being charged

attributes.action: Make ATM Charges Illegal
attributes.background: ATM charges can make it impossible for poor people to access their own money without falling into debt. If you share my belief, that this is appalling, then sign my petition. Banks cannot be allowed to make further profit from poverty.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of Pyrotechnics at UK football grounds
attributes.background: The majority of countries within Europe and South America allow fans to use pyrotechnics such as smoke bombs and flares at football matches however current law states that in UK they are not allowed and the use of them can lead to stadium bans as well as custodial sentences.
attributes.additional_details: Football banning orders for use of pyrotechnics are at minimum 3 years through a court and can go up to 10 years. Even if you are caught with the smoke bomb in a bag search, the punishments can be just as harsh as if you had let it off.

attributes.action: More funding for the NHS Blood Donation Service
attributes.background:
The NHS Blood donation service needs more direct funding. 

The service has cut services in the last few years, and regular blood donors are unable to find local sessions to make their donations, often waiting many months. This happens despite the regular appeals to for priority donors.
attributes.additional_details:
Regular donors, even priority donors, often have to wait for months to obtain an appointment to give blood.

The blood donation service has many reasons for an insecure blood supply stock: seasonal demand, lack of new donors, and relatively few donors from certain groups of the population. 

If the blood service continues to cut donor session availability, this could cause serious supply issues in certain vital blood stocks, such as O Negative, B Negative, and A Negative.

attributes.action: Increase the VAT threshold for small businesses.
attributes.background: As a small business that operates on a purely residential basis - in private homes where any added VAT is not claimed back by home owners - I feel that all small businesses would benefit from a raised VAT cap which would allow them to grow and would boost the economy further.
attributes.additional_details: Small companies make up 96% of the business in the UK and contribute to 33% of employment and 22% of turnover. I feel that if small companies - specifically ones that cater purely to the needs of private households where added VAT is only a hinderance for all involved - had an increased VAT threshold of anywhere between £110,000-£150,000 then they would be encouraged to grow and in doing so support the UK economy even more.

attributes.action: Review GB Domestic Driving hours.
attributes.background: 5.5 hours driving with a 30 minute break followed by another 4.5 hours driving is surely a health and safety issue. Bring it inline with EU Driving hours. 4.5 hours driving then a 45 minute break.

attributes.action: Amend Highway Code to include guidance for pothole avoidance
attributes.background: With the increasing number of unmarked dangerous defects in our road surfaces nationwide, there is no guidance in the Highway Code regarding a safe approach. Does one brake sharply, swerve, or proceed over the defect rendering your vehicle or motorcycle uncontrollable and potentially damaged?

attributes.action: Make interest on student loan repayments tax deductible.
attributes.background: Currently, the interest we pay on student loans is not tax deductible. Every year, 6.1% interest is charged on our student loan balance. Assuming we finish university £40,000 in debt, we have £2,440 a year of interest payments to make before we are even able to reduce our principal balance.
attributes.additional_details: Under the current system, you would have to earn about £52,111 just to be able to pay every year the interest on your balance (assuming you have £40,000 debt). The government then charges you 40% tax on your interest payment, costing you £976 a year. Assuming you earn £52,111; you are paying the government £3,416 (976+2440) a year for borrowing their money (without decreasing your balance). Corporation have tax-deduction on their interest payments, so should students.

attributes.action: Extend Sunday trading hours
attributes.background: To increase the trading hours to match the other 6 days of the week would increase revenue and employment. Sunday trading laws are out dated and the product of an old fashioned mindset.

attributes.action: ban homework
attributes.background:
i don't like homework, students don't like homework, teachers don't like homework, so why is homework a thing? we don't need it, so lets get rid of it!
it prevents social building of students, and increases the workload heavily on teachers. homework is bad for everyone, the recipient, and producer.
attributes.additional_details: i hate homework, so let's get rid of it

attributes.action: Rule out involving our NHS in a trade deal with the US
attributes.background: Theresa May has refused to rule out trading away our NHS in a deal with the USA. We want to show that that is not the will of the people.

attributes.action: Amend class size legislation rule
attributes.background:
We lost our appeal to place our son in the closest school because of class size legislation 
His Dad is disabled and can't walk more than 200 metres and doesn't drive
The new school is 2 miles away so doesn't qualify for assistance there is no bus service or proper pavement
attributes.additional_details:
All relevant Doctors, Stroke Spealist and nuerologist reports were included and ignored His Disability award was provided 
The closet school mentioned it would make sense for our son to be allowed based on Dad's health. The rule was upheld above my child's safety and my husbands disability. 
Fundamentally this rule needs to be changed, forcing a disabled parent to travel further so his child can be educated is unacceptable if he can't get there. My child will walk 4 miles a day he is 5yrs old.
